content.10: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
content.12: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,
content.13: And led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.
content.14: Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

content.16: But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.
content.17: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also
content.18: And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.
content.19: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.
content.21: Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them: behold, they know what I said.
content.22: And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?

content.27: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.
content.28: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.
content.29: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?
content.30: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.
content.31: Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:
content.32: That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.
content.33: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
content.35: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?
content.37: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered,
content.38: Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault
content.39: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
content.40: Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
